importantArticles.headline: Dividend stocks are a blessing to investors because they provide income and don't rely on stock price appreciation to reward shareholders.  You can't go wrong with dividend payouts at any time, but they're especially helpful when there's a lot of uncertainty in the stock market.  If you want investment income without worrying too much about stock price movements, the following two dividend stocks are worth adding to your stock portfolio.
importantArticles.title: The 2 Smartest Dividend Stocks to Buy Right Now

importantArticles.headline: If you're retired, you can use that money for your living expenses, and if you're still far from retirement, you might simply reinvest those dividends into more shares of stock -- perhaps shares that will start kicking out dividend income of their own.  Let's say that you're looking to collect around $1,000 per year in dividends, and you're interested in investing in telecom giant AT&T (NYSE: T).  AT&T was recently trading for around $27.30 per share, and it was paying out $1.11 annually in dividends per share -- in quarterly installments of $0.2775.
importantArticles.title: Here's How Many Shares of AT&T You Should Own to Get $1,000 in Yearly Dividends

importantArticles.headline: AT&T (NYSE: T) shareholders have plenty to celebrate, with the stock up 24% thus far in 2025.  As such, AT&T has emerged as a reliable source of stability amid the broader stock market volatility that's causing concern about the strength of the U.S. economy.  Can AT&T's record-setting rally continue, or is it time to hang up the phone?
importantArticles.title: Where Will AT&T Stock Be in 1 Year?

importantArticles.headline: Legendary investor Bill Gross told investors that they shouldn’t try to buy the dip after the worst stock-market drop since the pandemic.
importantArticles.title: Don’t buy the dip, legendary investor Bill Gross warns. He likes three stocks for now.

importantArticles.headline: While many stocks in the S&P 500 ETF posted dismal performance in the just-concluded quarter, we discuss some that rose by more than 20%.
importantArticles.title: 10 Stocks of the S&P 500 ETF Up More Than 20% in Q1

importantArticles.headline: We recently published a list of Jim Cramer Says We’re Entering a Bear Market and Breaks Down These 10 Stocks. In this article, we are going to take a look at where AT&T Inc. (NYSE:T) stands against other stocks that Jim Cramer discusses. On Friday, the host of Mad Money opened the show highlighting a […]
importantArticles.title: Jim Cramer on AT&T (T): “This Stock’s Got Its Mojo Back”
